website_summaries.verdict: Though pricey, it delivers Canon's impressive print quality and wireless capabilities in a sleek, portable model.
pros: Space-saving design with optional battery backup
Crisp print quality for documents and photos
cons: Optional battery backup is convenient but expensive
Slow print time for some items

website_summaries.verdict: While this is a pricier option, its compact size, portability, and wireless printing ability make it an impressive color printer for any college student.
pros: Printer provides easy wireless printing, even printing from mobile devices
Compatible with PC and Mac computers
cons: Setup of this printer takes some time and effort

website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you need a portable wireless printer. However, be prepared to spend some time and effort setting it up.
pros: Easy to sync to smart devices to print almost anywhere
Slim design makes it easy to transport and fit in work areas with limited space
Prints in color and black and white, and does a good job printing photos
cons: Difficult to set up, and calling Canon's tech support line may or may not be helpful
Some reports of error messages for no apparent reason

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and unreliableVery disappointing. Only lasted 7 months before major issue.
customer_reviews.text: This unit seemed fussy and flimsy from the start. After 7 months of light use, it required a new print head. The repair was covered under warranty, but the shipping to and from Canon facility was $40.00. After a few more months, it gets a false paper jam error preventing it from printing. Not worth sinking more $ into this very weak device. Total disappointment as I've invested in extra cables, hardshell case etc.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars now 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my truck office. Small ink cartridges. Could use a place to store paper. Update This went from 5 stars to 3 because after using it for several month as a part time printer, probably less the 15 pgs and 4-5 time usage. I had a very hard time getting it to accept that there was paper in it. Countless errors messages. I did everything in the trouble shooting but no luck. Finally yesterday I gave up and returned it (great customer service from Amazon by the way) I ordered a different brand this time
customer_reviews.author: Neil Mason

customer_reviews.title: Canon- you should be ashamed of yourself.
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself pretty tech savvy (I'm a web developer) and this POS iP110 printer is the worst... even worse than my old Epson 730. It's almost impossible to get this printer setup on the same wifi network and be prepared to go through the setup each time you want to print something. If any of the product developers from Canon are reading this, I hope you get a bad case of indigestion. Yeah, makes no sense; but I'd like to know that you at least have some frustration that I encountered with this abomination of a printer.
customer_reviews.author: August West

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer!
customer_reviews.text: So far very good I had a bit of trouble trying to figure out how to connect wirelessly, but once I did is working great prints excellent I’m using my iPod and iPhone. I also download the software on my computer to check on connectivity and works great it has a lots of great options. It prints just as good as my laser printer. I will update if anything else occurs. So far I’m very pleased now I can take printer to my meetings and clients!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS NEW CANON PRINTER.
customer_reviews.text: IF you want to set up easily, call Canon. I LOVE CANON CUSTOMER SUPPORT. Some very nice person will walk you through the set up, even though the diagram is (I thought) pretty simple. I AM NOT TECHNICAL but I set it up fine. When I got to the "connect to the printer wirelessly" I just called Canon. Be sure you connect to Canon USA and not some fake CON company that tries to sell you support. Canon offers free tech support for their products and it is really really good. Why not make use of them, they're happy to help.
customer_reviews.author: AdventureGirl

customer_reviews.title: I love how small this is
customer_reviews.text: I love how small this is. I only rarely need to print, so I am happy to have a printer that takes up so little space when I am not using it. The print quality is excellent. I am also really happy about the compatibility. Being able to print over bluetooth from my android phone is a really nice feature. I can print pdf files from my e-mail without even needing to turn on my computer
customer_reviews.author: James Paige

customer_reviews.title: Instructions & Setup a NIGHTMARE
customer_reviews.text: As noted by others, the INSTRUCTIONS are Atrocious, setup a nightmare, and GUI not intuitive. I called Canon and they required remote access to my work computer.... NO ! Finally found a YouTube that pointed me to canon.com/ijsetup. Finally got win7 laptop via USB to work using the download from canon.com/ijsetup Yet to be seen IF I can get this to work with iPhone/airPrint Apparently there is a secret, not documented way to toggle between USB-wired and wireless. Im a teckkie and this wasted hours dinking around. I still may return this
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Cartridges dry up and make the printers cost per use not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this printer. I travel a lot and I need something small that I can print documents from truck or hotel room. I've printed fewer than 400 pages and the color cartridges continue to dry up and not print. I run the maintenance provided with multiple clean nozzle heads and deep clean and nothing fixes the situation. I've contacted tech support and they have me run the same maintenance and then suggest I use a new cartridge which I do and it works for about 50 pages and dries up. For the cost of the cartridges and the need to continually replace the old after a few prints jobs this printer isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: jaqs

customer_reviews.title: Good printer — until it stops working
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my Canon printer for 4 years now and I have always liked it. However, it recently started displaying a false paper jam error and I can no longer print at all. There is no paper jam. We tried performing a roller clean, but couldn’t do so because the false paper jam error precluded the cleaning process. I have tried to call tech support before giving up on it, but tech support is non-existent. This seems like a problem with a possible solution but there is no way to find out. I will not buy another Canon, because I have discovered that they do not provide technical support.
customer_reviews.author: coffeelover

customer_reviews.title: Great small printer
customer_reviews.text: Love my little printer Works great in the rv and doesn't take up much space at all Most printers are so big and bulky. My little canon printer is just right
customer_reviews.author: Heros

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS, especially if you're a MAC user
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a cheap piece of crap. The directions that came with it are utterly useless. After 2 hours I finally broke down and called Canon customer service. Ultimately I was able to set it up to work with my desktop and IOS devices, but the procedures I used were completely different from the instructions that came with the printer. I also googled how to set it up for a Mac, there is no useful information online as of 10/9/2018. Just call Canon. Or, better yet, do not buy this piece of crap in the first place. It is a flimsy, cheaply made piece of junk that takes forever to print even one page of black & white text.
customer_reviews.author: corcovado

customer_reviews.title: Set up is a nightmare! If you have a Mac, don't buy this printer.
customer_reviews.text: This is an utter nightmare to install on a wireless network. I'm slowly losing my mind trying to do it right now. One problem is that the printer does not have the latest driver for the most recent Mac OS and there does not seem to be anywhere on the Canon site where the right driver can be downloaded. At this point, the Canon setup is telling me to use a USB cable to connect the device to my laptop. Now, if I wanted to have a connected printer, I could have bought one for much less money. This is supposed to be a wireless, portable printer, but alas.......
customer_reviews.author: B. McEwan

customer_reviews.title: I want 4 hrs of my life back
customer_reviews.text: I started setting this up at 10:00 pm. It's now past 1:00 AM and I'm still having trouble getting it to print. Printhead misalign, won’t print text pg, AirPrint starts to work then spits a blank page out. Downloaded the recommended drivers. Incredibly lousy setup process, crap instructions, very difficult to trouble shoot. Had to re-align printhead several times, and still scrapes/smears ink as it tries to print. I'm a tech savy person. My friends often ask me for help when their devices don't work. I just lost several hours of sleep trying to get this set up before work tomorrow. What a waste of time. It’s going back.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: I purchased it because of it's small size and thought it' be good for printing recipes and photos for my vision board
customer_reviews.text: This printer is OK. I purchased it because of it's small size and thought it' be good for printing recipes and photos for my vision board. Of course the time I needed it the most was when it decided to malfunction. After less than a year of very minimal use it developed an unrecoverable issue with it's paper feed mechanism. Fortunately, I was able to send it back for replacement under warranty but I'm somewhat hesitant to use it now.
customer_reviews.author: A. Santana

customer_reviews.title: NO AirPrint
customer_reviews.text: My big mistake.. It said wireless printing. For any other printer in the world for Apple iOS or OS X products, this mean the seamless wireless direct printing via Apple's AirPrint, as other Canon printers have. This does NOT have AirPrint. Setting up to have direct printing to the printer, especially if using your computer, requires you to DISCONNECT from your WIFI internet connection and connect to the printer as if it was a WIFI router, thus you can not browse the internet and then print at the same time. Anyone want a new hardly used printer?
customer_reviews.author: Carlton S.

customer_reviews.title: has not worked yet
customer_reviews.text: This printer has not yet worked for me. I travel and bought it for that purpose. It prints the test page and after that all I get is "printer not responding". Amazon helpdesk told me to reinstall the drivers which I did and same thing. I was on the road so now the return window has passed. I will be getting an USB cable which really defeats the purpose of wireless but will try it . Otherwise, lost of $200+
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Setup a Pain
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review after over an hour of frustrating, failed attempts to setup the printer wirelessly. I've never had such a problem with a printer before. Looks like I have to get an USB cable. Who has a USB cable these days?! it doesn't come with one in the box of course, so I have to waste even more time going to the store to get a cable. Tried downloading the driver from the internet and no success. I have decades of experience with printers and NEVER have I had this sort of problem before. UGH!
customer_reviews.author: Midori

customer_reviews.title: ... star rating due to the fact that I feel like the name is very deceptive
customer_reviews.text: I give this a 2 star rating due to the fact that I feel like the name is very deceptive. It calls itself a Wireless Mobile Printer, but you can't really do a direct computer to printer wireless connection. You have to route it through a wireless router. This effectively kills the usefulness of wireless connection if you are going to be using it away from home. It is a "mobile" printer after all. I got this for printing documents when I'm at court and so I'll have to spend 10 dollars on a cable to connect and print.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kim

customer_reviews.title: Gigantic pain to set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought a mobile scanner recently and it was set up in 5 minutes. So, I got some confidence that a mobile printer would be easy too (easier than going to the print shop every time anyway). Wrong. This printer is a huge pain. It comes with three sets of directions none of which are understandable. I had to buy a cable for set up because the wifi instructions don't work. They don't include the cable or even instructions on what kind of cable they are thinking. Terrible customer experience.
customer_reviews.author: McCullers

customer_reviews.title: I have read a lot of poor reviews stating that it is not compatible with Mac ...
customer_reviews.text: I have read a lot of poor reviews stating that it is not compatible with Mac and it is, that's what I use. Air print also works, but the set up isn't stupid proof. You do have to follow directions, sorry. I bought this to replace ip90, I'm not as happy with the print quality with this one the ip110. Leaves lines when printing photos sometimes even after head cleaning. For photos I'd not recommend it. Update: printer seems to have permanently clogged heads. Don't waste any $$ on it.
customer_reviews.author: CR Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great travel printer
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable. Amazed that a small device can deliver such great quality. This was extremely useful when paired with the Fijitsu scanner... talk about productive. My only hope is that Office Depot doesn't stop carrying the print cartridges. I bought a travel case. it's not a great case but it's doable I try to keep extra ink in the case. I wish I had a case that would fit this and the scanner. Should I need to reconnect it to my hotspot... I have difficulty remembering the process and I have to look on-line. Thankfully the instructions were easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Outdoorsy

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended. Find something better
customer_reviews.text: Terrible instruction set included with the printer. It seems to take MANY rounds to put the ink cartridge in before the printer finally accepts it, despite locking properly with sound feedback and blinking feedback both behaving according to instructions. When that is done, you ralize that Canon has skimped and not even added the USB cable to connect the printer to the PC/Mac. What an absolute joke. Build quality is also pretty bad. Couldn't be done in cheaper plastic. Not recommended unless you want to be upset :)
customer_reviews.author: hexeract

customer_reviews.title: What happened to Canon?
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap, plastic machine that looks and feels like a toy. That would be excusable if it worked, because most things seem to be cheap plastic anymore. What is not excusable is the _terrible_ software and lack of support. The instructions are badly translated to english and refer the user to a web setup page that no longer exists. the proper drivers can be found by searching the cannon sites, but are so badly written that they are unusable on a late model computer running windows 10 because they do not display properly (late model HP Spectre PC). Canon is no longer a brand to be trusted, and I will avoid them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: SEAN RAREY

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this printer before we left the country. We wanted something that was small, lightweight, and easy to use. Now we are able to print anything we might need while we are in Europe. Set-up was easy. I downloaded the Canon print app to my smartphone and set it up so we could skip having to find a WiFi server everywhere we go. Printing was easy and fast. Before we purchased it, we did some research and found this one was still the most recommended on tech sites. The price was good on Amazon, about $50 cheaper than Best Buy. I would recommend this for anyone who needs access to a printer while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: carrieB75

customer_reviews.title: THE INSTRUCTIONS ARE WRONG- you have to search youtube for the video showing you how to connect via your wireless router
customer_reviews.text: Take note! THE INSTRUCTIONS ARE WRONG!! Don't follow the instructions that come with this printer if you are using a mac laptop. They are wrong and you will spend hours trying to figure it out. You have to search youtube for instructions on connecting the printer by pressing a button on your wireless router. Once you find these instructions the set up is easy, BUT THE CORRECT INSTRUCTIONS ARE NOT INCLUDED WITH THE PRINTER AND HARD TO FIND ONLINE. I'm only using caps in hopes that you'll pay attention and not spend all day doing the wrong thing.
customer_reviews.author: Yoda Sunrose

customer_reviews.title: Travel printer that sucks for travel
customer_reviews.text: I realized as i was trying to even set this up for wireless testing at home, that it will not work at all for what my needs are. I bought this to replace my beloved ip100, which i've had for years (and used with a bluetooth adapter). I work freelance, and i need to be able to print wherever my "office" may be. I do not have access to routers in hotels or large stages, so this printer is worthless to me. It boggles my mind that Canon does not have the ability to connect a printer to the internet without physically pressing buttons on routers, this is OFTEN impossible. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Emily L.A.

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are laking clarity, very hard to set up
customer_reviews.text: This item is incredibly difficult to connect to an IPAD. I am pretty good with tech things, so when my mother called me to come over and help her set this up, I was feeling rather optimistic. First, the instructions are very poor. They are basically just simple pictures with hardly any written guidelines. You need to download the free app to connect with an Ipad. I did that, but the connection would cut off and on. The test sheet printed fine, but when trying to print anything else, all it did was spit out blank pieces of paper. Not happy with this item at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bingo

customer_reviews.title: Smallest, lightest package for 'mobile' printing in color
customer_reviews.text: Currently the smallest and lightest printer out there... Quite a refined product after the iP90 and iP100 generations so ability to connect using hardwire USB, WiFi and Mobile NFC, and print in full color, really makes this portable versatile. The optional (but expensive) battery is just brilliant for mobility. Downsides: the startup 'calibration' is very long, and the paper feed cannot work in windy conditions. The ink is very expensive and low capacity -although this whole rig is not set up for large print jobs (25 pages max) nor heavy duty printing. Print heads seem to clog randomly requiring another $75-$100 investment.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne W.

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to set up
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many printers over the years. I have never encountered one that I *couldn't even set up*. The instructions are useless, and despite trying to get this thing working from two different computers and two different phones, all I achieved was to waste an hour of my time. This is supposed to be a mobile, versatile printer. I can't be more disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: hudsongirl

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I hate this printer. The set up instructions blow. I was able to set it up by googling additional instructions. I’ve had to update my WiFi settings and it has been a stupid nightmare to get it to reconfigure. I’ve followed the set up instructions, I’ve downloaded the app, I’ve followed everything. It still won’t update and will. Not. Print. I can’t even use it anymore and it’s just a waste of space and money now. Going to take it and beat it office space style. Don’t buy this. Save your money and headaches and get something better.
customer_reviews.author: erriuga

customer_reviews.title: Painless Setup & Operation
customer_reviews.text: I was able to connect an iPhone 6 and Samsung tablet in minutes without cables or the DVD. After downloading the correct Canon app it directed me to Canon for some choices in connecting the phone. I did use the WPS button on the back of our WiFI router while making certain the WIFI light was flashing on the printer (as other helpful reviewers suggested), and had to enter our wifi password. Have printed screen shots and docs. Everything working great. An extra black ink was $14 right here on Amazon. Much quieter operation than our Epson all-in-one.
customer_reviews.author: lakewalker

customer_reviews.title: Great, BUT not the wireless...
customer_reviews.text: While I've always liked the Canon Pixma printers and have always given them 5* ratings, I am slightly disappointed with this one. The only reason being, is that as portable as this printer is, it's very difficult to use it when travelling using different WiFi networks. After 45 minutes with customer support, I learned you have to reinstall the driver every time you switch networks!!! It would be so much easier if it worked through Bluetooth. So, since I'm travelling 24/7/365 and using different WiFi networks every few days, the "wireless" capability is too bothersome to use! That being said, everything else is great and what I expected from a Canon printer.
customer_reviews.author: WICheesehead

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I set up the printer in under 15 minutes for my Mac, iPhone and iPad, over my wireless router and without any cables. I didn't really follow steps, but just went with the gut feeling. IMPORTANT: This printer connects wirelessly. Like with ANY OTHER bluetooth/wireless device, to "activate" the pairing mode, you must press and HOLD blue-lighted button on the printer for 3-4 seconds. When blue lamp lights up with 2 rapid sequential lights, followed by a pause of no-lights, it means your printer is in "pairing" mode, it can be discovered on the network and it can be accessed by your Mac. That's the whole trick.
customer_reviews.author: Dm

customer_reviews.title: 2 years on--planned obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer, so much so that we bought three over the years. The first one, however, has fallen victim to a preset page counter. It was still printing beautifully when it stopped mid-printing and the error flashed. Of course, Canon will happily reset it for a price, but it's cheaper to just buy another one after shipping and labor. Very disappointed. It's not like we use it that often with the other two around. Very disappointed, but hey, that's how businesses stay in business.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiSA

customer_reviews.title: Sailed through set up.
customer_reviews.text: I waited to set up this printer so I would have a big block of time if I had to call customer service. Didn't need to contact them. Following the picture diagrams was a breeze. Printer is up and running and software download was almost automatic. I didn't use the software provided because my iMac took care of it. I have no idea what people are talking about when they say set up was a nightmare. I am extremely tech challenged and I did it with no frustration whatsoever. Now I hope it keeps printing as well as it does now.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Chick

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this printer!
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this printer a overall rating of 1, I’m a huge fan of Cannon printers but I must say this is the worst printer I have EVER purchased. From set up to overall printing it’s a total mess. It does print when it feels like it . It’s somewhat okay but the paper feed doesn’t know what the heck it’s doing and tells you to feed another way, oh BTW there is no other way. The feeder is too short so your paper folds backwards. If not needing it ASAP I WOULD RETURN. I’m so disappointed Cannon and the money I spent on this I could of bought a cheap after market printer that works better.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little portable printer. We bought a case for it and it travels just fine. Set up was easy and, as a precaution, I also took a cable so I didn’t have to depend on wireless if there was a problem. The print quality is very good and the machine is fast. The printer has a solid, quality feel and operates smoothly. It was really great to print directions, notes, boarding passes, etc. in the hotel room.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good travel printer but difficult to set up wireless Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an older HP Mobile printer for my travels. This printer is much lighter. It prints very well and about the same speed as my older printer, but prints better. I will say my experience with setting up the Wi-Fi only connection was very difficulat and took up the better part of my afternoon. My router did not pick up on this printer. I was able to connect the wired connection (it was easy) so I did that. Later I was able to somehow get the router to recongnize the printer. I will have to take my USB wire with me just in case I have more issues on the road.
customer_reviews.author: CvilleBoy

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I tried for quite some time without success to get the printhead alignment function to work. Then I tried to reach Canon support, which is non-existent. Then I took it to a local techie and paid him to work on it for approximately an hour before he gave up and advised me to return it as defective. Thank goodness for Amazon return policy! FYI, it has USB connectivity capability but is not shipped with a USB cable. I'm not going to give Canon the USB cable I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: The Realtor Geek

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever. Been waiting for years for this technology. 12 3/4"x 7"x 2 1/2" LxWxH about as small as my clip board
customer_reviews.author: Kim Check

customer_reviews.title: Great quality - Super easy to travel with - Also my everyday printer.
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer... I have been using mine (at home and traveling) for almost 3 years now. This one, I bought for a friend. We just don't need the scanner anymore, because I do that with my phone and who in the heck faxes anything... This is a little workhorse with great quality and when I buy ink.. Well, I save boatloads of money. I buy 2 color and 5 black for under $20. That's a bargain. I bought a semi hard sided case for it to travel and it holds my cords, some paper and extra ink. Super good deal..
customer_reviews.author: GypsyBroker

customer_reviews.title: Insanely portable.
customer_reviews.text: Insanely portable. I use mine in the car for work and its always connected to my iPad. Replacing the ink every month with ALOT of prints in-between. No complaints with this printer, very surprising that it does exactly what it says it does without a problem or fighting to get it to work. Highly recommended to those who do mobile work and need a mobile printer to use on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Light, portable and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer. It’s easy to set up, easy to connect to any device: phone or laptop. Prints instantly. For those of you who complain that it doesn’t have scanner option, there’s an application that you use with this printer called Cannon Print. it has a feature “smartphone copy” that allows you to take a picture of the document and it automatically fixes and aligns it. Generally nobody uses scanners anymore as a lot of these phone apps do a good job. The only thing is it’s a bit overpriced. Otherwise I love the fact that it’s very light and so easy to use. I strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good for my needs
customer_reviews.text: There were mixed reviews so I considered buying a much more expensive printer. So far, very glad I didn't. I needed a portable printer that would work wirelessly with my ipad for a few pages here and there on the road without a wifi router. This does that fine. Instructions say "Canon Selphy/Print" app may be useful for setup so I used the app and it automated much of the setup. I was using airprint from my Ipad 20 minutes after the box arrived. Don't expect desktop printer performance because this is slower, that said it works great for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Great for Truck Business savers time
customer_reviews.text: * For Excellent presentation of a product * For fast delivery * For brand new no scams product * Easy and secure money transactions * Great partnership and communication between seller-store and Amazon. Product: This printer made for business to keep it in car or truck. No car adapter, no battery included. Buy cheap AC inverter for car. Printer needs only 21Watts. I use it for business. 1. I get bill of landing through internet on my phone. 2. If I need paper copy, I disconnect internet and connect printer to make copy.
customer_reviews.author: Yakov Pantofel

customer_reviews.title: Forget the instructions
customer_reviews.text: If you're a Mac user, this printer DOES work, and it does airprint just fine. You just need to toss the worthless instructions and read the work-arounds posted by other reviewers. You'll need to get a USB cable suitable for printers and initiate the setup from your directly connected laptop. The rest is pretty straight forward as far as adding this printer to your wireless network.
customer_reviews.author: P. Krembs ~P.K.~

customer_reviews.title: Returning. Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I can't get this to work. I need to be able to print in remote locations where WIFI and even cell coverage is not available. I've followed every rabbit hole canon offers including "simply scan the QR on the packaging" Apparently that QR code is outdated as well. Don't waste your money if you need to connect via Bluetooth, it simply does not work. Edit: I got the thing to connect, but it has huge issues feeding paper. Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Scott E.

customer_reviews.title: Set aside time for setup before going on the road/going mobile
customer_reviews.text: Set up is absolutely atrocious. It took 3 hours to get it going. Pro-tip: first install from your phone before trying to install on a computer. Unlike some of the other reviews on the internet, I was able to setup mobile printing from a hotspot versus wifi; again this was after downloading the app on my phone, having my phone connected to a hotspot, then connecting the printer to hotspot. Another setback is toggling between connections. Printing from wifi, then switching to hotspot, then to corded took a while for me to figure out. Will update review once using it on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin O.

customer_reviews.title: Bought end of April, used a few times and it does not print anymore...
customer_reviews.text: It worked for 5 months... and today stopped printing. Paper would go through but nothing on page... Did the suggested clean up of the printing head, now it prints but colors are off and it is slightly blurry. Worst thing is the alignment when you print shipping labels and all lines are distorted. I would love to improve the quality but not sure how.
customer_reviews.author: Painter

customer_reviews.title: A little difficult to get set up, but worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most handy printer I have EVER had. You can print right from your phone without having to have internet in your home. It was not the easiest to set up, but once we got it it has been awesome. I print all my eBay labels from my phone to this. You can't be real far away from the printer, but I don't mind having to be close when I print. Once past the set up it has been smooth sailing. It's awesome byou can also hook up to vehicle to print on the go. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: liz l.w.

customer_reviews.title: Canon needs to add drivers for download
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an iPad Air. I followed the instructions to wirelessly connect. After 2 hours of frustration, visits to Canon's site and the App store, I seriously pondered whether to return it or buy the adapters to manually connect the printer and forget about the wireless. As luck would have it, I connected the printer to my laptop to make sure the printer was working. Sure enough, it needed drivers. I transferred the drivers to the iPad and it worked fine afterward.
customer_reviews.author: S. Whatley

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a portable printer to print invoices for my business. This one said it was battery powered and needed D batteries. So I ordered this printer and D batteries. Come to find out it doesn't take D batteries. I now need to purchase a $90 external battery to be able to use this without plugging it in. Disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Tyler C.

customer_reviews.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly Review
customer_reviews.text: Superb printer. I am throwing my big expensive laser Brother in the trash. And to be able to print from an iphone, ipad in sittu using a bettery is just brilliant. I have just ordered another one for home office. Only downside, its a royal pain in the bits to set up. And you won't get much help online or from the manual. Always bemuses me why these things ooh and arr and click and grown for ages and ages before being ready.
customer_reviews.author: Downwind

customer_reviews.title: Good printer would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Like the others recommended I did not put in the disk and loaded the driver off the Canon website and had less issues than what others reported. Still have to figure out how to print direct without a cable but so far so good. I don't know why these are so expensive except that it is portable and most business people are willing to pay money for it to be portable. You can buy a regular printer for home a lot cheaper that plugs into the wall, just that it is not portable. The price is too high add the extra ink and battery and it is really high but business people need the portability and business people will pay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fails after a year of use!
customer_reviews.text: So, initially I loved this thing! Worked great. We only used it a few times a month. Always worked nicely. However, now I am extremely frustrated that this printer no longer is connecting with WiFi for wireless printing. It takes a long time of repeated attempts and multiple error messages to get one document to print. I have tried rebooting the printer by unplugging. But it never seems to get better. And this problem is not limited to my phone. Our WiFi in the house is otherwise working. Well and the location of the printer hasn’t changed. I am incredibly frustrated and angry at the prospect of having to buy another printer! NOT GOOD! Don’t recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Printer Errors Out Every Time. Only Worked Successfully Once.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is very cheap quality and has some serious software issues. I was only able to print one page successfully. Too bad the time frame to return has expired or it would be getting sent back. The troubleshooter says there are no errors. The printer does not blink in any way to note there are errors. However, each time a document tries to print it states there is an error. I have tried using it over wifi and even with a cable. No luck. A unusable brick of a printer.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Printer Cord too
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because I travel and needed a small printer. I originally had a iP100 and loved it using a printer cord. After five years it finally wore out and bought the iP110. I had problems with the network set up. Then started reading the other reviews. Don't even bother with the Wireless Setup. This system was designed by Engineers who as kids were picked on constantly and are now getting their revenge by creating mass frustration. Just by a printer cord and get on with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S. Alloway

customer_reviews.title: Good print quality, easy to use as an air printer, lightweight and portable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, little printer. Very portable, good-enough quality printing, very easy to use. Setup was simple with my WiFi, to use as an air printer. But in order to connect it to my iPad, I had to purchase some hardware. It says it’s USB-compatible, which is true, BUT, it won’t accept a USB device directly. I had to purchase an adapter from the printer port to USB (female to female). Then it worked with my USB to lightning adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like it but...
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer. But i never would have got it going wirelessly without these reviews. THANK YOU!! Here, you will learn the SECRET set up steps: If you're asked for a password, it's the printer's serial number. Restart your laptop or whatever device when set up is complete. Voila! Go have a drink...you'll need it!
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Short printer life. Beware of the 12 flashing lights of death.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer because I work remotely and am frequently in need of printing documents. Ive had to purchase this printer twice in the last 3 years. Everything starts off okay then you get the 12 contiguous flashing lights of death. Initially the the 12 consecutive flashing lights mean that the battery needs to be recharged however, if that’s all been taken care of and you continue to see the 12 flashing lights then it means the printer, itself, no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: G Hilaf

customer_reviews.title: Small profile and has ability to attach battery
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my car for work. I have to print labels for work on a regular basis and I may not always be at the office. I like that it has the ability to attach a battery as I also don’t always know if I’ll be able to plug it in either. So far it’s been working fine. The black ink seems to bleed a little bit on text but I’m not sure that it’s the printer. I think it’s actually the paper I’m using. I will update the review if I ever end up having an issue with it but so far I haven’t had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: This is very close to being a five star product!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best printers I've ever bought and used. It has all the features you would want in a mobile printer, except that it can't easily switch between wireless and cabled modes. AND THAT WAS ALMOST A DEAL BREAKER! But I've learned to live with it, and other than that very notable shortcoming, this printer is excellent. It's small, light, fast and accurate. It's easy to setup and work with. Most of all, it's very reliable. This is what you want if you need a mobile printer.
customer_reviews.author: Stevae

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the neck to use
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this printer. There is always an issue connecting to WiFi, and the paper never feeds properly. Sometimes it takes as many as 8 or 10 tries before the paper finally feeds properly. It prints OK, but between trying to get it to connect to WiFi and getting the paper to feed properly, it's just not worth all the trouble. I just purchased an HP Tango printer, and it's a million times better. Super easy set up, always connects to WiFi as soon as I turn it on, and there's never an issue with the paper feeding properly. The documents print clear and vivid.
customer_reviews.author: tonyb

customer_reviews.title: MAC Troubleshooting
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to download the Canon Printer Selphy app to set up the wireless printing. Install the driver to laptop, but then set up wireless through a mobile device. Printer is small and print black and white super fast!
customer_reviews.author: RockaPants

customer_reviews.title: no wireless conection
customer_reviews.text: only purchase cause i needed a small printer due to no room at home for regular sized printer. price and print quality not bad. unable to connect wirelessly from pc or android devices. followed directions to the t. have other wireless printers that connect fine, just not this one. online help was not helpful. will keep since printer works fine with usb cord. just disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Castro

customer_reviews.title: Three stars - No longer has Blue tooth
customer_reviews.text: I have had one version or another of this printer for about ten years. They have gotten steadily better, up till now. But, the new printer no longer has a blue tooth input. I work in a lot of remote locations using public wi-fi. So, the wi-fi option is off the table and I need to run a cable to use the printer. It's not the end of the world, but it can be inconvenient when my computer is in front of me on a desk and the printer is in a back office or some such. The blue tooth was perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: K2D2

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tricky to get my computer to recognize it but if you follow the instructions starting with 6 it takes you right through it. If you don't go wireless, the USB port is on the right and it uses a standard A to B cord.(separate purchase) It prints faster than I thought it would. I am very pleased with the size and apparent durability of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: E. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: small printer for printing on the go
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer to take on business trips and sites. Was a bit apprehensive after reading the reviews about setting up the printer being difficult. The instructions included with the printer was very clear. Followed the instructions for inserting the printer head, cartridges which was quite easy. I used direct wireless connection for connecting both the laptop and my iphone and the whole setup took not more than 30 mins. Did a test print and printing speed was faster than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Fathin

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this small printer to use when traveling. But yet they want me to use my WiFi in order to use the wireless feature. But I will not have my WiFi when I'm on the road, so the wireless feature is worthless. Otherwise the printer seems to work well. The ink cartridges are cheaper and more easily available than with my previous printer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tope

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRINTER BUT NOT FOR THE WIRELESS
customer_reviews.text: Okay . . . so I've had this printer over a little two years. first things first - if you want a reliable 'wireless' printer this is NOT it. So my partner is an actual IT director and he couldn't seem to get the the wireless feature working consistently. BUT once we purchased a USB-B cable, this printer works like a dream and is always reliable. I actually love the printer now - and would recommend if you are looking for a tiny at-home printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Requires wireless router & confusing instructions
customer_reviews.text: The manual is incredibly confusing for setting the printer up. After I set it up I learned the printer is defective - the printer head/gears perpetually cycle but nothing happens. Also it's wireless so it requires a wireless router to function, or you can print documents from your smart phone. The compact size is great but the wireless feature ruined it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this take the time and set it up right be patient it’s worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great quality prints and works great with my Ipad and with no wifi or Internet I am so happy I bought this and the refills are inexpensive
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Compact printer with excellent quality for travelers
customer_reviews.text: Pros: compact (can take on plane); great photo quality Cons: instructions not clear to print via wifi; recommend that you just download their mobile app (Canon Print); it’s much easier to follow the instructions in app to add a printer Conclusion: would recommend it for people on the go or need a mobile office. Unfortunately we still can’t do w/o paper printouts in this day and age
customer_reviews.author: James Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this Canon iP110 printer for use in our Motorhome. I was tried of having to move our HP printer from the house to the motorhome... If I would have known how good this printer is, I would have bought 2 of them, instead of the HP Mobile Printer, I purchase a week ago for my wife. The print quality of this Canon is excellent! The ink cost less and it was so easy to set up, compared to the HP 200 Mobile Printer.. This is the printer is a Buy ! The more I think about it - I will be returning the HP Mobile Office Jet 200 Printer and save the $64.00 cost difference
customer_reviews.author: G.M.

customer_reviews.title: Works for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I travel and need to have a portable printer. Print quality is very good, the printer however will last a year, maybe two for me. I carry it in a backpack with my computer, so it gets bounced around a bit. Print cartridges do not last as long as they should, and preparing to print takes longer than the print speed. It can often take 4 minutes to prepare to print a single page that prints in 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Water Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Easy compact nice printer
customer_reviews.text: To all the people here telling other that the setup on this printer is hard, you guys have no tech drive. It took me about 5 mins to set it up with my iPhone and print from it. READ instructions and you’ll see how easy is to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Marrero

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: junk... stopped feeding paper... older model lasted years... this newer version is garbage... 2nd one this model in a year that stopped working correctly.. I will not buy again
customer_reviews.author: wolff

customer_reviews.title: the best printer I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This printer is small and great for my tiny apartment. Once I figured out how to get it set up and connected, which took me a total of about an hour, this printer has never failed to work and is a wonderful and efficient little machine. I couldn't be happier, and it has been about two months so far of using it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: MossyFernForest

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I was out of town for several months and dependent upon my cell phone and tablet for communication. Receiving information was not the challenge; I also quickly discovered that I needed to print much of what was being emailed to me. After researching my options I chose the Canon Pixma iP110. It was an excellent choice. It works perfectly and was easy to assemble and use. I purchased a carrying case a few days later. My next buy will be the LK-62 Rechargeable Lithium-Ion Battery for total portability.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great travel printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I travel to client sites. Regular printers do not work; ink leaks, printer heads jam, poor printing. This printer has been great no issues. Fits with paper, extra ink, and cords in catalogue case. Make sure you read instructions. Printer must be shut-off [not unplugged] so printer head goes to storage position capping head. Paper exit must face up in transport. Compact easy to transport. On draft mode getting high quality print; ink lasts a reasonable amount of printing. Well worth the price; clients are impressed that I am prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Wm O Rights

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small, portable printer that delivers the high quality printing we all want.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second portable printer and we love the Canon printers the best. It travels well, the print output is the same excellent quality that you get with the larger printers. If you need a portable printer, look no further. We recommend a neoprene case (Cosmos has a great one on Amazon) if you are going to be traveling with it. Great overall quality, nice durable unit with a locking magnetic clasp that keeps it all in one piece. We expect we'll get another 5 years or so of use from this printer that our last Canon gave us.
customer_reviews.author: FredK

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer in spite of the hassle.  Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this was a royal pain during initial set-up on my laptop, throw away the CD and download the updated driver from the net. Once the laptop was connected my iPad Air and Samsung Note 3 connected easily and there's no problem printing on either. I LOVE this little printer. Bought it for work as many client offices will not allow connecting to their network. Not a substitute for a good home printer, for instance one cannot print in draft mode, but great for on the road. Clear, sharp print jobs. YOU WILL NEED TO BUY A PRINTER CABLE, not provided.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and smallest printer that work with normal paper
customer_reviews.text: First, I like the fact this printer is the smallest and most affordable printer that works with normal paper (not thermal). Set up was fairly easy, works fine with the wireless system and Airprint. I wished it was bluetooth capable so you could work in the field when there is no network. I am going to try to see if I can get it to work outside the home network. I gave it 3 stars because of connectivity options.
customer_reviews.author: msamadian

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this little printer
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this little printer!! We bought it for our RV as we full-time and have an small office. It's small but mighty. I had a bit of issue trying to pair it but I just hook up the printer cable; no big deal. Be aware, you can only load about 8 sheets of paper at a time. It takes a bit of time for it to warm up. But dang, it stores so compact! Great for small home office for boat or RV.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Brown

customer_reviews.title: It is Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great. I replaced an older model that also was great but got clogged up by sitting to long and not used. I will try and fix that. But back to the Printer. It is easy to set up and use. My primary use is on driving trips where we met friends. Nice to give a picture or two of our group doings and print out any reservations or special information. Most of our trip friends are older and phone pictures are OK but actual Pictures are better.
customer_reviews.author: GWzeus

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I travel for work and my first printer lasted around 18 months before the paper started jamming and feeding skew making it useless. My second printer lasted 6 months before it started doing the same. Troubleshooting, cleaning and tech support not able to fix. Seems like an inherent problem. Many people at my firm report similar issues. I guess I am going to have to spend more get an HP250 which while larger seems to have few problems
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Great small, capable printer (but ignore manufacturer instructions !)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small printer with wireless capabilities, and this is the one ! It works great. HOWEVER - DO NOT FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS FOR WIRELESS SETUP. THEY'RE CONFUSING AND DON'T WORK. Another reviewer stated to click the button on your home router (no I never knew it existed but in fact it does !) to pair your printer to your home network and that worked in SECONDS.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Helmsley

customer_reviews.title: They are the best. the ip 110 lets me print photos directly ...
customer_reviews.text: My third Canon printer. They are the best. the ip 110 lets me print photos directly from my cell phone with its wireless feature. Easty to use and you are backed by an outstanding custoer service taff to hlep you install and use the product, They will stay on the phone with you until you hae it right if, like me, you're not technically inclined. Call them as often as you need and it is all free. When this one wears out, I'll get another Canon printer.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Washkevich

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to make stickers on glossy/matte paper and the print quality is clean and sharp. The printer is compact and very easy to set up; however I did need to use a usb cable (not included) to connect my computer to the printer initally to set up the wireless connection. Afterwards, it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Lee

customer_reviews.title: No good, don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer thinking it would be a quick solution to be able to print simple things while working from home. We are an all Apple device family so the air print compatibility was appealing. It could be user error, or a bad unit, but this is the worst printer I have ever used. Air print rarely works off of a mobile device and the only way to actually get the printer to work is my plugging it in to my desktop (which isn’t why we bought it). I’d like to believe there are much better options out there than this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Good travel compact Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer for traveling. To set up the wireless can be difficult. But I called support and they were very good and fast. Once on a specific network, if you want to change the network, it takes a lot of Tech knowledge to press the printer buttons with different counts and setting it up with the lap top. I suggest if you set a wireless network up, make sure it is the one you will be using most of the time. But I recommend it otherwise. For the cost, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: hrussell

customer_reviews.title: Frustratingly Intermittently Functional
customer_reviews.text: When it chooses to print the quality is great but its been incredibly intermittent and I have some devices that it refuses to print from despite saying that it's printing. Many times when it actually has printed on command, I had all but given up when it suddenly went into action 5-10 min later. It is super slow per page. I should have returned it unfortunately let the return window expire. On a positive note, the size is perfect and the color quality is great. I have not yet engaged with customer service. Hoping some of the issues are able to be resolved.
customer_reviews.author: T.Nic W

customer_reviews.title: How to setup the easy way.
customer_reviews.text: Mac Book Air 2019, Buy the usb type cord. Your CU will then be able to find the printer and retain it. Done, you do not need the cord anymore. Cord cost $6.00 - $12.00 dollars
customer_reviews.author: SPURCHASE

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: We could not get this printer to work after hours of configuration. The print head was faulty and we couldn't return it or speak with Cannon support because they require you to create an account online with your printer's serial number. Our printer's serial number wasn't registering on the site, so we weren't able to get support. We should be able to return this product, but we are outside the 30 day window now. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great travel Printer!,
customer_reviews.text: Nice portable printer, bought to replace IP100 because it has wireless, air print. capability. Great price, other places it is $250 -$300. Highly recommended 🤗👏 Canon name and inks are the BEST quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Arizona customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Frustrating connecting to WiFi to print off website
customer_reviews.text: Each time I connect to printer directly or automatic, it doesn’t want to connect. Instead it will say unable to communicate with printer. Then I have to start the whole process over trying to hook up WiFi to Canon_ij_ and identifying the printer. This kills so much time and very frustrating. But when it does connect finally, it prints flawlessly without a problem. If it had more smooth connection to print off websites I would definitely give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant about the set up with this product based on previous reviews but, I must say, I am technologically impaired and I had absolutely no issues with the set up on my IPhone, IPad, IMac, and MacBbok Pro. The printer is compact and prints great photos!! The compactness was especially important since we live and travel in a motorhome.
customer_reviews.author: Motorman

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: So it does the job. For what ever reason, my Macbook Pro won't hook up to it via modem, so I have to use the WIFI work around. Meh. I mean it prints all my shipping labels so I don't have to go to the post office, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jill G

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for not a lot of space
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my college dorm and 3 years later it’s still working strong! It’s very efficient with its ink use. I highly recommend this for anyone trying to save space on their desk/office. My only complaint is I have to use a wired connection to print but hey it still gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Compact and fast. Difficult WIFI Setup.
customer_reviews.text: Setting up the printer so all network devices, including iPhones, was actually really time consuming and difficult. The directions were robust, but still not enough. I think there must be limitations that we’re not clear. In the end I abandoned any Canon suggested WiFi connections and resorted to the USB PrintShare through my netgear router. The unit is compact. So it’s expected the ink will run out quick. On the ink pack that came with the printer, I’ve printed one 160 page document, and already have the low ink warning.
customer_reviews.author: Uraswedishfish

product_meta.title: Canon Pixma iP110 Wireless Mobile Printer With Airprint And Cloud Compatible
product_meta.description: Style:PrinterSophisticated and Sleek Mobile Printer for business professionals on the go
feature_bullets: The PIXMA Printing Solutions (PPS) app easily lets you print photos or documents from your compatible mobile device. With the Cloud print function you can print directly from select online cloud services with your mobile device using the free PPS app
Easily print wirelessly from select online cloud services with the Canon PRINT app
Easy PhotoPrint+ allows you to easily edit and print your photos from anywhere you have Internet access
9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi produces incredible resolution and detail in both business documents and photos
DPS over IP compatible device required

OS Compatibility - Windows:12 Windows 8, Windows 8.1Windows 7, Windows 7 SP1 Windows Vista SP1, Vista SP2 Windows XP SP3 32-bit. Mac:13 Mac OS X v10.6.8 - 10.9. Mobile Operating Systems- iOS, Android, Windows RT

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,559 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
